headline.main: THE CAMPAIGN IN THE WEST; THE COLUMBUS MYSTERY. Particulars of the Expedition Down the Mississippi--Commodore Foote Uncommunicative--Criminal Neglect of the Wounded.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday morning, soon after daylight, four armored gunboats, one wooden one, five transports partially filled with troops, and two mortarboats, left here in the direction of Columbus. Expectation--to use a not entirely original metaphor--stood on tiptoe. Everybody, including one or two reporters who had succeeded in getting an invitation to accompany the expedition, was nearly insane with relation to what the next twenty-four hours would bring forth.

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN KANSAS.; Renewed Confidence in Government--Rejoicings Over the Late Union Victories--Quarrel between Gens. Hunter and Lane--The Expedition Probably Abandoned--Lane Going Back to Washington--The Lane and Robinson Fight Still Raging--Lane and the Methodist Church, &c.

docs.snippet: The bill authorizing attorneys residing in adjoining States, to practice in the Courts of this State, was reported favorably, and on motion of Mr. CON- NOLLY the bill was passed.

headline.main: PROCEEDINGS OF THE LEGISLATURE; SENATE. ASSEMBLY

docs.lead_paragraph: The bill authorizing attorneys residing in adjoining States, to practice in the Courts of this State, was reported favorably, and on motion of Mr. CON- NOLLY the bill was passed.
